com.teamwork.autocomplete.util

Class ConstraintComparator<T>

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.teamwork.autocomplete.util.ConstraintComparator<T>
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.util.Comparator<T>

    public abstract class ConstraintComparator<T>
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.util.Comparator<T>
    Abstract implementation of Comparator that supports an additional text constraint to implement custom ordering rules when filtering objects based on a user-entered input.

    Extend this class and implement your compare(CharSequence, Object, Object) method as if you were using a standard Comparator.

    This class is thread safe, and subclasses should maintain this property.

      • shouldCompare

        public boolean shouldCompare()
        Return whether the currently set constraint requires sorting. The default implementation returns true when the constraint is not null or empty.

      • compare

        @WorkerThread
public final int compare(@NonNull

        Specified by:
        compare in interface java.util.Comparator<T>

      • compare

        @WorkerThread
public abstract int compare(@Nullable
                                          java.lang.CharSequence constraint,
                                          @NonNull
                                          T o1,
                                          @NonNull
                                          T o2)
        Compares the two objects for order, providing the current text constraint for filtering and applying custom rules to the ordering.
        Parameters:
        constraint - The constraint text.
        o1 - the first object to be compared.
        o2 - the second object to be compared.
        Returns:
        a negative integer, zero, or a positive integer as the first argument is less than, equal to, or greater than the second.
        See Also:
        Comparator.compare(Object, Object)
